answers.answer: Hi!If weight is the cause of your loss of periods, then hypothyroidism, diabetes, and polycystic ovaries, adrenal gland problems and severe anemia should be ruled out. All these can cause weight gain, and can also affect the menstrual cycle. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: I am 21, I Never Been On birth control, I Never Been Pregnant, I havn't had Sex in 4years, and i haven't had a period in 11months...when i finally went to the doctor ...they told me everything was Normal they ran alll kind of Test and all came out Normal....they told me to lose weight and i have..they said it could be my weight...im 5'6 and 277 pounds...idk I'm scared.....even tho said im healthy...im Not trying to have any kids...im too focus on school, work, and my career... but im scared i wont be able too one day when I'm ready... please any comments....
title: Havn't Had in more than 11months
